byline.contributor: Campbell Robertson contributed reporting from Baton Rouge, La.

abstract: Justice Dept releases study outlines steps police departments across country can take to make officers safer, including waiting for backup and use of body armor; study comes at time of increased concern about attacks on police; experts say some measures could be difficult to implement due to issues with funding and staffing.
lead_paragraph: Among the Justice Department recommendations were using body armor, waiting for backups on certain calls and giving responding officers better information.

headline.main: Study Proposes Steps to Better Ensure Police Officers’ Safety
headline.print_headline: Study Proposes Steps to Keep Officers Safer, Like Armor Use
